Berlinang 'ayaq' mata [METROTV]
03 Nov 2019, 21:00 by Mohd Rizal Abdullah dan Noorazura Abdul Rahman



KEKALAHAN pasukan Kedah 0-3 kepada pasukan Johor Darul Takzim (JDT) pada perlawanan Akhir Piala Malaysia 2019 di Stadium Bukit Jalil, malam tadi, ternyata ‘meruntun’ jiwa terutama penyokong cilik pasukan Hijau Kuning itu.
Telatah dan gelagat ‘comel’ penyokong ini mula tular di laman sosial sehingga mendapat perhatian ramai yang kagum dengan semangat mereka.
Antaranya, rakaman video Muhammad Syafi Rayyan Syahrillnizam, 8, yang mulai menangis apabila JDT menjaringkan gol kedua pasukan itu.
“Kedah kalah, depa (mereka) kalah dua dah...dah banyak kali doa, dah beratus-ratus kali dah... tak boleh menang lagi,” kata Mohd Syafi menerusi rakaman video dan dikongsi di Facebook (FB) sejak malam tadi.
Sementara itu, Muhammad Syafi Rayyan yang dihubungi berkata, dia sedih dan kecewa apabila JDT menjaringkan gol pertama, dan bertambah sedih bila JDT menjaringkan gol kedua dan seterusnya.
"Saya sedih apabila melihat jaringan pertama, dan apabila melihat jaringan kedua, saya tidak dapat menahan perasaan.
"Memang dalam hati saya dah berdoa agar Kedah dapat jaringkan gol balik selepas JDT menjaringkan gol pertama.
"Tetapi, bila masuk jaringan kedua dari JDT, saya rasa hilang semangat dan terlalu sedih, lebih menyedihkan apabila masuk jaringan ketiga," katanya.
Katanya, disebabkan terlalu sedih kecewa, dia sukar tidur kerana asyik teringatkan perlawanan itu.
"Tetapi, hari ini dah baik, dah tak sedih lagi, " katanya.
Ibunya, Nor Farizan Ismail, 34 berkata, anaknya tidak dapat mengawal emosi dan tiba-tiba sebak apabila JDT menjaringkan gol kedua.
“Meskipun begitu, dia masih menyaksikan perlawanan sehingga habis.
“Tetapi masih dalam keadaan kecewa dan sebak sehingga ke bilik tidur,” katanya yang menetap di Sungai Petani.
Katanya, anaknya memang penyokong tegar pasukan bola sepak Kedah dan tidak pernah terlepas menyaksikan sebarang perlawanan membabitkan pasukan Kedah di televisyen.
“Memang begitulah telatahnya, kalau Kedah kalah, memang dia sedih, kalau menang dia orang pertama yang bersorak,” katanya.
Perasaan sama turut dikongsi Aiman Muhaimin Zul Azhar, 8, dari Taman Wira, Mergong yang tidak dapat menahan kekecewaan sehingga menanggalkan jersi dan mencampak ke lantai.
Rakaman video Aiman turut tular dan menerima pelbagai reaksi dari orang ramai terhadap gelagat kanak-kanak itu.
“Saya mula sedih pada jaringan pertama, dan apabila masuk jaringan kedua dari JDT, saya rasa kecewa sangat sehingga menanggalkan jersi dan melemparkannya ke lantai.
“Selepas jaringan ketiga saya terus masuk ke bilik,” kata peserta Akademi Tunas Kota Setar di bawah Persatuan Bola Sepak Malaysia (FAM) itu.


PENYOKONG tegar pasukan Kedah, Muhammad Syafi Rayyan (kiri) dan Aiman Muhaimin. FOTO Norazura Abd Rahman

Berlinang 'ayaq' eyes [METROTV]
03 Nov 2019, 21:00 by Mohd Rizal Abdullah and Noorazura Abdul Rahman



THE FAILURE of the Kedah 0-3 team against Johor Darul Takzim (JDT) in the 2019 Malaysia Cup Final at Bukit Jalil Stadium last night seemed to 'crush' the soul, especially the small supporters of the Yellow Green team.
The adorable 'adorable' antics and behavior of the fans have begun to spread on social sites to the attention of many.
Among them, video footage of Muhammad Shafi Rayyan Syahrillnizam, 8, started to cry when the JDT scored the team's two goals.
"They have to lose, they have lost twice ... twice, twice, hundreds ... never to win," Mohd Syafi said via video recording and sharing on Facebook (FB) last night. .
Meanwhile, Muhammad Shafi Rayyan, who was contacted, said he was sad and disappointed when JDT scored the first goal, and was saddened when JDT scored the second and so on.
"I was sad to see the first network, and when I saw the second network, I couldn't bear the feeling.
"It is in my heart to pray for Kedah to score a goal after JDT scored its first goal.
"However, when I entered the second network from JDT, I was overwhelmed and very sad, much sadder when I entered the third network," he said.
He said that because he was so upset, he couldn't sleep because he kept remembering the match.
"But today is good, not sad anymore," he said.
Her mother, Nor Farizan Ismail, 34, said her son was out of control and suddenly burst into tears when JDT scored his second goal.
"However, he still saw the match to the end.
"But still in frustration and weeping up to the bedroom," said a resident of Sungai Petani.
He said his son was a staunch supporter of the Kedah football team and had never missed a game involving the Kedah team on television.
"It is a joke, if Kedah loses, she will be sad, if she wins the first person to cheer," he said.
The same feeling was shared by Aiman Muhaimin Zul Azhar, 8, from Taman Wira, Mergong who could not bear the disappointment of removing the jersey and throwing it on the floor.
Aiman's video recordings were also infectious and received many reactions from the public over the boy's behavior.
“I started to feel sad on the first network, and when I entered the second network from JDT, I was so disappointed that I took off the jersey and threw it on the floor.
"After the third network I continued to enter the room," said the Kota Setar Tunisian Academy under the Football Association of Malaysia (FAM).


The staunchest supporters of Kedah forces, Muhammad Shafi Rayyan (left) and Aiman Muhaimin. PHOTOS Norazura Abd Rahman
